question: 月光
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>moon</kanji> <kanji>light</kanji> (not sunlight!) can be bright sometimes. This is night when you're stumbling home from a nomikai after work. What is this light from the moon called? It's <vocabulary>moon light</vocabulary>. This word can also mean a <vocabulary>moonbeam</vocabulary> as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>月</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

The <vocabulary>moonlight</vocabulary> brings out a strange creature known as a <reading>Geck</reading>-<reading><ja>こう</ja></reading><ja>いち</ja> (<ja>げっこう</ja>), which are geckos with the head of <ja>こういち</ja>. Imagine a swarm of them all crawling out of their crevices once the moon comes out.
